title: Mount Fuji
description: Mount Fuji is the tallest mountain in Japan, standing at 3,776 meters (12,380 feet). Mount Fuji is the single most popular tourist site in Japan, for both Japanese and foreign tourists.

title: Eiffel Tower
description: The Eiffel Tower is one of the most iconic landmarks in the world, located in Paris, France.

title: Pyramids of Giza
description: The Pyramids of Giza are ancient pyramid structures located on the outskirts of Cairo, Egypt. They are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

title: Sydney Opera House
description: Sydney Opera House is an iconic performing arts venue located in Bennelong Point of Sydney Harbour, Australia.

title: Grand Canyon
description: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, USA. It is one of the most famous natural landmarks in the world.

title: Colosseum
description: The Colosseum in Rome is an ancient amphitheater, known for its gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

title: Taj Mahal
description: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum located in Agra, India, built in memory of Mumtaz Mahal, the wife of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan.

title: Christ the Redeemer
description: Christ the Redeemer is a statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

title: Great Wall of China
description: The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications that stretches over 13,000 miles, originally built to protect against nomadic invasions.

title: Milford Sound
description: Milford Sound is a fjord located in the South Island of New Zealand, known for its dramatic scenery, including steep cliffs and waterfalls.
